verses.roman:
rāya kahe,--"lokera sukha ihāra śravaṇe
abhīṣṭa-devera smṛti maṅgalācaraṇe"

synonyms: rāya kahe—Rāmānanda Rāya says; lokera—of the people in general; sukha—happiness; ihāra śravaṇe—in hearing such poetic expressions; abhīṣṭa-devera—of the worshipable Deity; smṛti—remembrance; maṅgalācaraṇe—in the performance of auspiciousness in the beginning.
translation: Rāmānanda Rāya said, "Instead of joking, people in general will feel great pleasure in hearing such poetry, for the initial remembrance of the worshipable Deity invokes good fortune."
